Posted By: JudoThai (7/31/2010 9:00:59 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
A friend and I each pulled one of these at a prerelease. He kept going on about its ultimate, which struck me as odd.  
  
Ajani's ultimate should be the last reason you use him. Instead, he should be used as a continuous [Glorious Anthem](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Glorious Anthem) that boosts your creatures when it comes into play. Spam his -1 ability three times, then gain life, then use the -1 ability again. Your creatures will become enormous and there will be little your opponent can do about it short of mass removal, which still leaves you with an advantage, as Ajani will still be around to pump himself (and your life total) before you cast a creature again, at which point you'll be able to -1 once more, repeating the cycle.  
  
So yeah.
posts.html:
A friend and I each pulled one of these at a prerelease. He kept going on about its ultimate, which struck me as odd.

Ajani's ultimate should be the last reason you use him. Instead, he should be used as a continuous Glorious Anthem that boosts your creatures when it comes into play. Spam his -1 ability three times, then gain life, then use the -1 ability again. Your creatures will become enormous and there will be little your opponent can do about it short of mass removal, which still leaves you with an advantage, as Ajani will still be around to pump himself (and your life total) before you cast a creature again, at which point you'll be able to -1 once more, repeating the cycle.

So yeah.

Posted By: wilsonbiggs (8/11/2011 11:57:58 AM)

posts.post_content:
I'm surprised no-one has mentioned [Cenn's Tactician](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cenn's Tactician )   
  
All of you creatures can block two creatures... Put this with cards that like taking damage or blocking (i.e. [wall of hope](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=wall of hope), [belltower sphinx](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=belltower sphinx), [gorgon recluse](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=gorgon recluse), etc.) and it can quickly get very annoying.  
  
In fact, these two and wall of hope leads is a nice set up for his -6.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
I used to forget that his second also gives vigilance, a lot of time. In my aggressive W deck this always ended up that he would be defenseless after my attack and worked more like a 4 mana +1/+1 which would be pretty lame.   
After i realised it also gives vigilance, it changed a lot obviously because you can attack all the way without leaving him vulnerable. So yeah the vigilance is quite important in my opinion.

Posted By: GhostXi (7/9/2011 1:28:52 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Gotta love this card, is he the strongest planeswalker of them all? Depends on how your using him, my deck is built around Ajani's Pridemate almost all my cards give me health this is why Ajani himself is a big card in my deck everytime he heals me he gives Ajani's Pridemate a +1/+1 counter. By the time i have had Ajani out those counters have been brewing from Suture Priest and Soul's Attendent, which also means my health is pretty high up at this time. So all this health is immediately building my Pridemate and is also setting up the insta kill when i unleash the Avatar it may not be an insta kill for most people but i also threw in some whispersilk cloaks to make sure the avatar or the pridemate get through to the oppenent. So in my opinion i think he is the one of the strongest planeswalkers but he relies heavily on other cards to acheive that kind of power (half of them share his name though so they arnt hard to find)
